title: INC0139537 - Total Payroll Reports not working
custom_preconds:
Received from: Matt.Kleine@brewers.com 
Recipients: ebissupport@mlb.com 

Hello â€“ 

The â€œTotal Payrollâ€� reports have not been functioning for at least the past 24 hours or so. We have a fairly time-sensitive project we are completing presently that requires this information. Additionally, when I attempted a workaround using the Multi-Year report, it appeared to provide incomplete information (e.g. it shows us having just a $25m payroll in 2015). 

Is this a known issue already, and is it possible to get that resolved today?

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to require users to attach invoices to CSP Invoices
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on a players CSP tab


Wire:  https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=invoice_1
custom_steps: WHEN CEP Admin user is viewing a CSP invoice
custom_expected:
THEN User will be see a new 'Attachments'  section added to *CSP* invoice, as depicted in the wire. 
AND 'Attachments' will be required to save
AND Label options for the attachments will be:
  -- Tuition/Fees
  -- Books/Supplies
  -- Living Expenses
  -- Other Covered Expenses
AND If 'Other Covered Expenses'is selected as the label, comments will be required for the file
  -- The bubble icon will become red if no comments have been added
  -- Once comments are added, the bubble will turn blue

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want the values renamed in the Other Configurations section of the CEP Tracking Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN User is on the 'Configurations' section of the CEP Tracking tab
custom_steps: WHEN user views the field labels in 'Other Configurations' section of the CEP Tracking Utility
custom_expected:
THEN the field labels will match the updates in both order and description:
-	CEP to SB Minimum Level -> Minimum Level (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Lower Threshold -> Minimum Signing Bonus (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Upper Threshold -> Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Signing Bonus Pct Minimum -> Signing Bonus-CEP Ratio (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Level Rank 1 Threshold -> Level 1 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 2 Threshold -> Level 2 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 3 Threshold -> Level 3 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 4 Threshold -> Level 4 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 5 Threshold -> Level 5 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Living to Tuition Minimum -> Minimum Living Used (Used 50% of Living; and Living Used > Tuition Used)
-	Add an adjustable leverage threshold for the Low Leverage Column. Titled Minimum Level (Low Leverage) preset at 3.

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want the Early Access to CEP column to use a rolling timeframe
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on CEP Tracking tab
custom_steps: WHEN User enters values into all fields and click load/recalc button
custom_expected:
THEN the new calculation for 'Early Access to CEP' column will use a rolling timeframe
AND will be "if a player has used any amount of his CEP within 24 months of their signing date, the player is allocated .60 points

*previous calculation was hardcoded to players signed in 2019 - 2020*

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to see the CEP Analysis section and filters
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has CEP Auditor perms

Wire: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis]
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to 'CEP Tracking' tab
custom_expected:
THEN user will be able to view the 'CEP Analysis' section on the CEP Tracking tab
AND the section will be expanded by default
AND THERE will be 3 filters:
-- Classification
-- Orgs
-- Signing Date
- AND User will be able to select Signing Date range from Date pickers

title: As a MNC Admin, I want the system to prevent players from signing as SFNY if their season has started
custom_preconds:
AC:

* On submit, the system will perform a rule check to confirm the League the player is being assigned to hasnâ€™t started
* If the "Sign for Next Year" checkbox is checked, and the the Signing Date is on or after the earliest game date for the League of the Affiliate the player is being assigned to, the system will return a error message:
** "This player may not be added as a SFNY Player to the \[Affiliate Name] as the \[Affiliateâ€™s League] has begun play.â€�
* The error will be a hard error for club users
* The error will be a warning for BOC users (Ignore & Continue)
* Donâ€™t fire in the negative case

title: As a MNC Admin, I want Sign For Next Year Checkbox Players to have a Sign For Following Season Transaction
custom_preconds:
Rule 10.3.7: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784593/10.+Pre-Approve+-+State+Change+rules

AC:
 - If a player has the "Sign For Next Year" checkbox checked, the signing will function as if the contract was being signed with a start year of the next calendar year
 - When moving from Terms Submitted to Pre-Approved, a "Sign for Following Year" transaction will be created if the box is checked

title: As a MNC Admin, I want the system to prevent an Org from having more than 50 SFNY players at a time
custom_preconds:
Rule 5.24: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784601/5.+Minor+Contract+-+onSubmit|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784601/5.+Minor+Contract+-+onSubmit|smart-link] 

AC:

* On submit, the system will perform a rule check to confirm how many SFNY the signing org has
* If the "Sign for Next Year" checkbox is checked, and the org has >= 50 SFNY, the system will return a error message:
** "This player may not be signed for next year as the signing org is currently at the maximum number of SFNY Players.
* The error will be a hard error for club users
* The error will be a warning for BOC users (Ignore & Continue)

title: As a MNC Admin, I want Add C's status to update to Expired when the MNC they are attached to Expires
custom_preconds:
AC:
 - When an MNC expires, all Add C that are attached to the contract will have their statuses updated to Expired
 - We should data fix all existing Add Cs to Expired if their MNC is expired
 - The initial C signed with the MNC should also be updated to Expired
  -- Not a separate field on the UI, but is a separate field in LINK
 - All Cs should be re-cached for Link (with their new Expired statuses) when the MNC expires

title: As a MNC Admin, I want to sign a player as SFNY after Jan 1
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When signing a player to an International 1st Year contract, if the current date is prior to the â€œMinor Contracts can be created for next yearâ€� system date, there will be a â€œSign For Next Yearâ€� checkbox in the Contract Details portion of the Addendum A section.
* The checkbox will be available after January 1st, which is the current cut off for signing players for the next year
* Players signed to a contract with the â€œSign For Next Yearâ€� checkbox checked will be given a SFNY roster status
* The checkbox will be visible until the â€œSign for next year system dateâ€�

title: As a Club User, I want to send an Outright Release NOD for esign
custom_steps: WHEN User creates a new Outright Release transaction,
custom_expected:
THEN an e-sign button will display in 'Submitted' state for users with the appropriate perms
AND clicking 'Esign' will open a menu for the user to select 'Notice of Disposition'
AND user will be able to complete the e-signature workflow for Outright Release transaction as per the standard Mn NOD workflow
including;
--Submitting the form for e-signature
-- rule check for Authorized Signatory that has a stored signature
-- rule check that the form hasnt already been e-signed
-- player signature from both the player signature widget and the transaction itself
-- club signature stamping
-- transaction updates canceling e-signature
-- user cancellation of e-signature
-- esign over email

title: As a Club User, I want to send a Transfer NOD for esign
custom_preconds: AC:
custom_steps: WHEN user submits a new Transfer transaction, there will be an esign button to users with the appropriate permissions (Submitted State)
custom_expected:
THEN users with appropriate perms will see see a Esign button display in 'Submitted' state
AND clicking 'E-sign' button will open a menu for the user to select "Notice of Disposition"
AND the user will be able to complete the e-signature wokflow for the Transfer transation as per the satandar MN NOD workflow including:
--Submitting the for for e-signature
-- Rule check for Authorized Signatory that has a stored signature
-- Rule check that the form hasnt already been e-signed
-- Player Signature from both the player signature widget and the transaction itself
-- Club signature stamping
-- Transaction updates canceling e-signature
-- user cancellation of e-signature
-- Esign over email

title: WLP club comm batch
custom_preconds:
Update to use Stats API

AC

* Players playing in winter league will have their stats populated correctly after running the club comm batch
* The stats should match up with stats on an environment that doesn't have this change in place.

title: Verify Stats batch
custom_preconds:
This should work as it always has, but should instead call stats api rather than use the oracle DB

AC

* verify stats batch should run without error and should run in a comparable amount of time to the oracle version.
* If a player violates any of the stat based checks, then a notification should be generated for them.

title: Makeable bonus
custom_preconds:
The makeable bonus batch needs to be updated to pull stats from stats API rather than from the oracle DB.

The stat calls that are needed should already exist in the MJC stat batch

AC

* Makeable bonus batch runs successfully in a comparable amount of time to before the update
* MJC_MAKEABLE_BONUS table is populated with data and matches up with the same data as a different environment that doesnâ€™t have the new batch running on it.  (Note - there may be some differences if data has been modified: contract states changed or contract bonuses adjusted)

title: Payroll  â€“ PlayerStatsDao
custom_preconds:
Stats used on payroll for PBâ€™s.

AC

* When a player with performance bonuses is traded in midseason stats are used to determine the payroll allocation.  After this update, there should be no changes to the players bonus allocations on their payroll when updating/saving the contract.

title: ClubBAMIdBatch
custom_preconds:
BAM TEAM ID matching (affiliate profiles)

AC

* Club bam ID batch should run without error and in a comparable amount of time.
* Removing a club bam id from an affiliate profile and running the batch should see it be filled back in.

title: PIEF List
custom_preconds:
The pief lists stats should be calculated using stats API rather than the oracle stats DB

AC

* PIEF list correctly calculates playerâ€™s statistics according to the requirements.
* Stats calculated on PIEF list in an environment that doesnâ€™t have the stats API change match up with the stats where the update has been applied.

title: Transactions
custom_preconds:
Transactions are currently checking stats for players to determine whether or not the transaction is valid.

Instead of making the call to the oracle stats DB they should instead call the stats API.

AC

* IL and inactive transactions which check against stats find that if the player has a game played during the placement an error is raised.
* IL transactions â€˜last game playedâ€™ field matches up with the value from their statistics.  (note comment below)

title: AS a BOC Admin, I want a new Spring Training LOP
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants to see new Sprint Training LOP
custom_expected:
THEN new Sprint Training 'Level of Play' will display
AND Spring Training LOP will be abbreviated to 'ST'
AND existing 'Spring Training' league will be re-associated to this LOP
AND new Spring Training LOP will appear below Class Low - A (After 1F) 

Notes:

 - Affiliates created in this League/LOP should have the 'Spring Training Facility' checkbox checked on its profile
 - If a player is optioned to a ST Facility during Sept, they should continue getting MJ Service
 - If a player is optioned to a ST Facility before Sept, player would not get service in Sept

title: As a BOC Admin, I want there to be an Org Wide Reserve List Limits
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants to see new Reserve List limits for both 'in-season' and 'off-season'
custom_steps:
WHEN user views Reserve List limit during In - Season 
-- defined as the period between '1st day of Mn system date (piv-704) and the date 5 days after the 'Last Game of World Series'
example: Last Game of WS: 11.1 plus 5 days (11.2, 11.3, 11.4, 11.5, 11.6) last day of in season is 11.6
OR user views Reserve List limit during Off - Season
-- defined as the period between the date 5 days after the 'Last Game of the World Series' & the 'First Day of the MN Season'
Last Game of WS: 11.1 plus 5 days (11.2, 11.3, 11.4, 11.5, 11.6) last day of in season is 11.6 and first day of off season is 11.7
custom_expected:
THEN the In-Season limit will be set to 180
AND the Off-Season limit will be set to 190

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a new System Date for Earliest MN Opening Day
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to System Dates tab
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a new 'First Day of MN Season" system date added to the 'Minor League' portion of the Baseball Ops section
AND this date will be used to determine when to switch to In-Season Org limit

title: As  BOC Admin, I want a new rule to check Active Under Control Limits
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants to see new rule check which looks at the overall total and compares to the approriate value
custom_steps:
WHEN following transactions are submitted/approved:
** Reinstate from IL
** Activate player (from Inactive list)
** Reinstate from inactive list
** MN Outright
** Option
** Option transfer
** R6 Return
** Return of 27th man (also 26, but that doesnt exist anymore)
** Loan
** Return
** Transfer
** Outright trade and Name player to be named later on outright trade if the player is in the minor leagues
custom_expected:
THEN rule check should fire if over the limit
** Logic should be similar to checkActiveUnderControlLimit rule
* Club Roster Info View will be updated with a count of total players for the org
* Club Roster Info View will be updated with the limit value, based on the time of the year
* New rule should be called everywhere that the existing checkActiveUnderControlLimit rule is called:

title: As a BOC Admin, I want new Active Limits
custom_preconds: AC: - There will be new Active limits instituted as follows:  -- AAA: 28 Active Players  -- AA: 28 Active Players  -- High-A: 30 Active Players  -- Low-A: 30 Active Players  -- Spring Training (story to follow): No Active Limit

title: As a BOC Admin, I want AAA to have it's own Reserve List in the Offseason
custom_preconds:
AC:

 - During the off-season, AAA will have it's own Reserve List limit of 38 players

  -- Off-season is defined as the period between the Last Game of WS (system date)+5 Days and the First Day of MN Season (system date)
custom_steps:
WHEN user is viewing any AAA (Triple A) affiliate in the 'Off-Season'
-- Off-Season is defined as the period between the Last Game of WS (system date) + 5 days and the First Day of Mn Season (system date)
custom_expected: THEN AAA club will have it's own Reserve List limit of 38 players

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Roster Notification Batches Updated for New Org Limits
custom_steps: Roster Notification Batch will update to reflect new Org Limits
custom_expected:
-- Clipboard Notifications
-- Emails (if emails arent being sent, dont create emails)

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Individual Reserve Lists removed from the UI
custom_steps:
WHEN user views the MJ Summary dashboard
AND Roster page
custom_expected:
-- We’re going to continue to show the under control number on the roster screen (we’ll add it back in).  But we are NOT going to show the limit in the popover with the exception of the AAA limit when its in effect (based on the new story’s logic).

-- for AAA, in season you will see both numbers and the popover will show the active limit but NOT the under control limit.  In the offseason, the popover will change to only show the under control limit and NOT the active limit.  For other minor league clubs, both the active AND the under control limit will be removed in the off season.  The only limit listed will be the domestic reserve count limit.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the MJ Summary Screen updated to display the Org's Current Total
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the MJ Summary Screen
custom_steps: WHEN user views the main portion of each Org's box on the MJ Summary Screen
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a new line added to box
AND the line will appear under 'Total Signed For Next Year'
AND the line is labeled 'Domestic Reserve List Total'
AND it will display the total number of players currently on the Org's Domestic Reserve List

title: As an AMT Admin, I want the players 0-6 months from signing to have a new day allotment
custom_preconds: Rules: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3797962/Eligibility+to+Enter+Club+FacilitiesAC: - Players who are 0-6 Months From Signing will no longer be allotted 15 days in a 45 day period, they will now be allotted 45 days in a 90 day period  -- This is the same allotment that eligible to sign players receive

title: As  BOC Admin, I want a new rule to check Active Under Control Limits When A Player Signs a MNC
custom_preconds: AC: - There will be a new rule check which looks at the overall total and compares to the appropriate value, 180 in season, 190 off season.  -- Logic should be similar to checkActiveUnderControlLimit rule - Club Roster Info View will be updated with a count of total players for the org - Club Roster Info View will be updated with the limit value, based on the time of the year - The ew rule should be called on submit and approve

title: INC0162409 Part 2 - Players with Incorrect Eligible to Sign Date
custom_preconds: AC:* There will be a new ‰ÛÏSigning Eligibility DOB Cutoff‰Û� system date in the International section of the System Dates screen* This date will be used to determine players eligible to sign dates* The date will default to 8/31, 16 years prior to the start of the Signing Period* Anyone born between 9/1 and the following 8/31, won‰Ûªt be eligible until the following signing periodExamples:if you are born 9/1/03 - 8/31/04, your ETSD is 1/15/21,if you are born 9/1/04 - 8/31/05, your ETSD is 1/15/22,if you are born 9/1/05 - 8/31/06, your ETSD is 1/15/23Caveat: all registration requirements must be met.  If you‰Ûªre in the first group but don‰Ûªt register, and then register in 2021, you‰Ûªre not eligible until the next signing period.----Received from: patrick.nathanson@mlb.comRecipients: ebissupport@mlb.com,matthew.salvatore@mlb.com,johan.minaya@mlb.comGood afternoon ‰ÛÒ The international amateur players in the attached report appear to have Eligible to Sign Dates of 1/15/2021; however, based on their dates of birth (after 8/31/2004), these players should have ETSDs of 1/15/2022. Would it be possible to fix each of these players‰Ûª ETSD on the backend?Thank you,Patrick [^ETSD 2021.xlsx] ---------------------------------This JIRA is to investigate why these players ended up with the wrong ETSD.A separate JIRA has been created to datafix the 141 players that Patrick reported. ([EBISII-19031])

title: As a BOC Admin, I don't want Club Users to Edit Positions on any player profile during the season
custom_preconds: AC:* No Club user will be able to edit player positions during the season* In-Season is between these dates:* Last Game of WS + 5* Opening Day - 3
